quiz_description: Test your knowledge of fundamental financial concepts for migrant workers in Singapore

questions.question: What percentage of your income should you save for emergencies?
questions.explanation: Financial experts recommend saving 10-15% of your income for emergency funds to cover unexpected expenses like medical bills or job loss.

questions.question: Which expense should be prioritized in your monthly budget?
questions.explanation: Rent and utilities are essential expenses that should be prioritized to maintain stable housing and basic living conditions.

questions.question: What is the purpose of an emergency fund?
questions.explanation: An emergency fund is specifically designed to cover unexpected expenses like medical emergencies, job loss, or urgent repairs.

questions.question: What is the minimum amount you should have in your emergency fund?
questions.explanation: Financial advisors recommend having 3-6 months of living expenses in your emergency fund to provide adequate financial security.

questions.question: Which is the safest way to send money home to your family?
questions.explanation: Licensed remittance services are regulated by MAS (Monetary Authority of Singapore) and provide better protection and lower fees.

questions.question: What should you do if you receive a suspicious call asking for your bank details?
options: Hang up and report to the bank
questions.explanation: Never provide bank details over the phone. Banks never ask for sensitive information via phone calls. Hang up and report to your bank immediately.

questions.question: What is compound interest?
options: Interest earned on both principal and previously earned interest
questions.explanation: Compound interest is interest calculated on the initial principal and also on the accumulated interest of previous periods, helping your money grow faster.

questions.question: Which document should you keep for tax purposes?
questions.explanation: Pay slips and CPF statements are important tax documents that you should keep for at least 7 years for tax filing purposes.

questions.question: What is the maximum amount you can contribute to your CPF Special Account?
questions.explanation: The CPF Special Account has an annual contribution limit of S$37,740 (as of 2024), which includes both employee and employer contributions.

questions.question: What should you do if you can't pay your bills on time?
options: Contact the company to arrange payment
questions.explanation: Always contact the company or service provider to discuss payment arrangements. Most companies are willing to work with you to find a solution.
